peregrine.http
Class HttpClientWriter

java.lang.Object
  peregrine.http.HttpClient
      peregrine.http.HttpClientWriter
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, ChannelBufferWritable
Direct Known Subclasses:
HttpPostMethod, HttpPutMethod
public abstract class HttpClientWriter
extends HttpClient
implements ChannelBufferWritable

A HTTP client that supports writing to the stream. AKA POST and PUT.

shutdown

public void shutdown()
              throws HttpClientException
Finish the HTTP request without waiting for the response. This can be useful with multiple parallel requests so that you can shutdown() all of them and then waitForResponse() on all of them at the once.

Specified by:
shutdown in interface ChannelBufferWritable
Throws:
HttpClientException

waitForResponse

public void waitForResponse()
                     throws HttpClientException
Description copied from class: HttpClient
Wait for an HTTP response from this channel. Without necessarily closing it. This can be used for connection reuse (AKA HTTP keep-alive). This is (by definition) a synchronous operation.

Overrides:
waitForResponse in class HttpClient
Throws:
HttpClientException

getWritten

public long getWritten()
Get the number of bytes written to this request. For persistent connections this is reset with each connect.
